author: Lauren Davis
title: South Knoxville Elementary School leads Title I schools across the district in 3rd-grade reading TCAP scores
text:
KNOXVILLE, Tenn. — A Knox County elementary school principal shared her tips for success after she was recognized for her school's record third-grade reading proficiency rates. Leaders said 80% of third graders at the South Knoxville Elementary School met or exceeded the English Language Arts portion of the TCAP.
It's a Title I school, so it gets federal funding to support students from low-income families to achieve academic success. Superintendent Jon Rysewyk said it's one of the highest performing Title I schools in TCAP reading scores across the district.
"One of our priorities, our four priorities, is great educators in every building. And for us, that means two things. That means a great teacher in front of every student every day and all the support staff that make that happen. But we always call out — it also means a great leader," said Rysewyk.
Rysewyk said the high reading scores were a result of Tanna Nicely's work as principal.
"Dr. Nicely has been a great example of doing that, to do the core things so that all her students no matter who they are, where they come from, are able to read at a high level," said Rysewyk.
He also said it's impressive to have a school have 80% of third-grade students meet or exceed the reading portion of TCAP.
"As the district, we're in the mid-40s, which again for us is the highest we've ever been with the new standards across Knox County Schools. So 80% for a single school is, is really impressive," said Rysewyk.
Nicely said reading is the foundation for most things and she wants all her students to have the equal opportunity to learn.
"It's an initiative. It's a part of what we do here at the school. Every child deserves a right to learn how to read and to read fluently," said Nicely.
She said as a first-generation college graduate, she wanted to make sure her students know that's something they can achieve too. She also said she wants other schools to know they can reach reading rates like South Knoxville Elementary School — if they put in the work.
"Excellence isn't by accident. It takes a lot of practice. It's not easy, but it's something that is achievable. I feel like with that kind of mindset, these kids know they can read. It's not an 'if' or 'if it happens someday' or whatever. They are reading," said Nicely.
She said not only is the school the top Title I school in Knox County for reading retention, but it's also second in the entire county.
Nicely was given a $10,000 dollar check by David Coffey, a local businessman, former legislator and public education advocate. He said the school and the principal are the "North Star."
"I'm impressed with it. Everybody is impressed with it. I think it's an honor to be able to honor you and in particular to honor the leader of your team, and that's your principal. There's a wee bit of magic in this room that goes on that manages to get better results of your reading than anyone else in all of East Tennessee and mostly the state," said Coffey.

author: Bobby Welber
title: Alert: 3 Feet Of Snow Predicted For Many Parts Of New York State
text:
Alert: 3 Feet Of Snow Predicted For Many Parts Of New York State
A massive number of New Yorkers are expected to have to deal with one to three feet of snow!
New York Gov. Kathy Hochul is warning New Yorkers about a Lake Effect snow event impacting many upstate locations.
Lake Effect Snow Warnings in Western New York, the Finger Lakes, Central New York, the Mohawk Valley and the North Country
New Yorkers living in Western New York, the Finger Lakes, Central New York, the Mohawk Valley and the North Country are under Lake Effect Snow warnings.
Hungry? Italy Says The Best Pizzeria In The World Is Found In New York
“Our agencies continue to work around the clock in coordination with our local partners as we respond to significant snowfall, strong winds and colder temperatures that are expected across much of the State through the weekend,” Governor Hochul said. “I encourage everyone to monitor your local forecast and stay alert as conditions can rapidly change or worsen.”
Snowfall rates of up to two inches per hour and winds gusting up to 45 miles per hour will likely impact travel.
Up to 3 Feet Of Snow Predicted
According to Hochul's office, anywhere from 1 to 3 feet so lake effect snow is predicted.
"Some locations, including northern Cayuga, far southern Lewis, Madison, Oneida, Onondaga, and Oswego counties could see between 1-3 feet of lake effect snow, while other locations could see between 1-2 feet of snow through this weekend," Hochul's office stated. "Visibilities will be considerably reduced and winds could bring down tree branches resulting in power outages. Travelers should prepare for rapidly changing road conditions."
Cold Temps, Gusty Winds
Colder temperatures and gusty winds are expected all weekend across New York State.
"Minimum wind chills ranging from the single digits across much of the state, not including New York City, Long Island and the lower Hudson Valley, to several degrees below zero in the North Country," Hochul's office states.
For all the news that the Hudson Valley is sharing make sure to follow Hudson Valley Post on Facebook, download the Hudson Valley Post Mobile
Next week, starting on Monday, an "arctic blast" will produce single-digit wind chills across much of the state.
Warning: 'Aggressive" Bear Destroys Home In Upstate New York, Returns
Residents in the North Country are told to prepare for temperatures "as low as 10-15 below-zero degrees" in the coldest spots through the week.
These New York Counties Deal With More Snow Than Most Of America
new studydetermined the snowiest counties in America. Many counties in New York State made the list, but the results may shock you.

author: WoV
title: ITA W: Igor Gorgonzola Novara Triumphs in Five-Set Thriller, Advances to Playoff Semifinals
text:
Igor Gorgonzola Novara secured their spot in the Serie A1 Tigotà Playoff semifinals after a dramatic 3-2 victory over Reale Mutua Fenera Chieri ’76 in Game 3 of the quarterfinals.
The match was an intense battle, with Novara bouncing back from losses in the first and third sets (20-25) to dominate the second and fourth sets (25-12, 25-17). The decisive tie-break saw Novara take control after a crucial turning point at 7-5, closing out the match 15-6 and celebrating a hard-fought victory.
Libero Eleonora Fersino was named MVP for the second time in the series, while Novara’s attack was led by Alsmeier (20 points), Aleksic (15), and Ishikawa (14). On the Chieri side, Skinner (17), Gicquel (14), and Buijs (14) put up a strong fight.
Igor Gorgonzola Novara – Reale Mutua Fenera Chieri 3-2 (20-25, 25-12, 20-25, 25-17, 15-6).
- Igor Gorgonzola Novara: Aleksic 15, Bosio 4, Alsmeier 20, Bonifacio 11, Tolok 13, Ishikawa 14, Fersino (L), Mims 7, De Nardi, Squarcini, Akimova (L), Bartolucci, Mazzaro, Villani
- Reale Mutua Fenera Chieri: Skinner 17, Gray 3, Gicquel 14, Buijs 14, Alberti 6, Van Aalen 4, Spirito (L), Omoruyi 2, Anthouli, Rolando, Guiducci, Lavagnino, Fanfani (L), Bednarek
Top scorers: Alsmeier L. (20) Skinner A. (17) Aleksic M. (15)
Top servers: Van Aalen S. (2) Aleksic M. (2) Ishikawa M. (2)
Top blockers: Aleksic M. (4) Tolok T. (3) Alberti S. (2)

author: ET Online
title: In Pictures: PM Modi performs 'Surya Arghya' at Vivekananda Rock Memorial in Kanniyakumari - The Economic Times
text: Kanniyakumari: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, as part of his meditation exercise, performed 'Surya Arghya' during sunrise on Friday at the Vivekananda Rock Memorial. This ritual, integral to spiritual practice, involves offering salutations to the sun, symbolising the Almighty. Modi, with folded hands, offered prayers and performed the ritual with a traditional, small beaker-like vessel, pouring water into the sea as an offering (Arghya). He used prayer beads (Japa mala) during this spiritual exercise. 110588592A short video clip titled 'Sunrise, Surya Arghya, Spirituality,' posted by the BJP on its 'X' handle, captured the Prime Minister in this serene moment. The video shows Modi, dressed in a saffron shirt, shawl, and dhoti, pouring water into the sea and praying with his japa mala. The BJP also shared photographs of the Prime Minister meditating at the Dhyan Mandapam. In these images, Modi is seen surrounded by slowly burning incense sticks, enhancing the spiritual atmosphere. He is also seen walking around the mandapam with his prayer beads. 110588610 The photographs and video clips, appearing to be taken at different times, capture Modi deeply engrossed in meditation and spirituality. However, the release of these visuals prompted a reaction from Tamil Nadu Congress president K Selvaperunthagai, who, in a post on 'X', taunted Modi for the multiple angles and videographers involved in capturing his meditation. How many angles! How many videographers! Swami Vivekananda is silent, the Congress leader remarked. 110588622Kanyakumari, renowned for its stunning sunrises and sunsets, houses the Vivekananda Rock Memorial on a tiny islet near the shoreline. Prime Minister Modi began his meditation at this iconic location on the evening of May 30, with plans to complete it on the evening of June 1.

author: Mark N Mengonfia
title: Liberia tanker blast death toll rises to more than 40
text:
A leaking fuel tanker that exploded earlier this week as people gathered to collect the petrol has left more than 40 people dead.
The blast on Tuesday also injured at least 83 people in the town of Totota in the central part of the West African country, health officials said on Thursday.
Many of the dead were buried in a mass grave on Wednesday because their remains were unrecognisable, said health official Dr. Cynthia Blapook in Bong County.
Authorities said an exact death toll was difficult to confirm because of how badly the bodies were burned.
Liberian Vice President Jewel Howard-Taylor attended the mass funeral.
"We never expected to start the new year like this," Howard-Taylor said.
Health officials said the number of injured could rise as they were not certain everyone had been brought in for care.
A doctor at one hospital treating the injured urged the Liberian government to deploy a disaster management team and to have one in each county to respond to emergencies.
Dr. Minnie Sankawolo-Rocks also pleaded with people not to approach fuel tankers in the hope of collecting much-needed petrol. Similar deadly accidents have occurred elsewhere in Africa.
"Please, I am begging you," she said.
Sankawolo-Rocks said people did not listen to police instructions to keep away before the tanker exploded.
